Ecgo Bike Tawarkan Motor Listrik Murah Hanya Rp 8 Jutaan, Tapi..
07 Nov 2019, 02:42 by Antara, Eko Ari Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Harga sepeda motor listrik masih mahal dengan alasan banderol baterai. Misalnya, sepeda motor listrik Gesits sekitar Rp25 juta dan Viar Rp17 juta sampai Rp18 jutaan. Adapun PT Green City Traffic (GCT) melalui produk sepeda motor listrik ECGO Bike -2 atau easy go ditawarkan dengan harga yang murah kisaran Rp8 jutaan.
Harga yang murah tersebut karena motor ini tidak dijual dengan baterai, namun konsumen bisa menyewanya. Hal tersebut dilakukan agar konsumen tanpa harus repot memikirkan harga baterai yang mahal.
COO dan CO-Founder ECGO Bike, Rosyeni, menjelaskan bahwa startup mereka menawarkan solusi mahalnya harga baterai dengan cara sewa. "Konsumen hanya beli sepeda motornya saja, baterainya tidak usah, melainkan disewa Rp95.000 setiap bulan atau jika mencapai 1.000 kilometer (mana yang lebih dahulu)," kata Rosyeni, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Jika dihitung biayanya Rp95.000/1.000 kilometer, maka untuk 1 kilometer pengguna hanya mengeluarkan Rp95 saja. Harga sewa baterai Rp95.000 setiap bulan tentu jauh lebih murah ketimbang biaya bensin menggunakan sepeda motor konvensional.
Rosyeni menjelaskan, berdasarkan data pengguna sepeda motor, pengguna tunggangan bertenaga listrik masih sebesar 0,007 persen di Indonesia. Sehingga terbuka peluang untuk memasarkan kendaraan ramah lingkungan itu.
ECGO yang tampil perdana di pameran GIIAS 2019 juga menarik minat pengusahan. Rosyeni mengatakan, hingga saat ini sudah terdapat 388 toko yang berkomitmen untuk menjadi distributor ECGO di seluruh Indonesia. "Dominan di Pulau Jawa, antusiasme mereka tinggi. Mereka bahkan sudah memetakan daerah-daerah mana yang akan menjadi titik penjualan ECGO," kata Rosyeni.
Melalui jaringan penjualan yang sedang dibangun, ECGO menawarkan kemudahan kepada konsumen untuk menukarkan baterai di mana saja melalui aplikasi ponsel.
Aplikasi ECGO pada ponsel akan merangkum berbagai hal berkaitan dengan kondisi baterai (low batt warning), anti theft warning, over heating, battery not in good health dan dan jarak tempuh sepeda motor listrik.
Mekanismenya adalah baterai dapat terhubung dengan server, kemudian server akan berkomunikasi dua arah kepada pengguna serta diler atau toko ECGO terdekat.
"Hadirnya banyak peminat untuk menjadi distributor ECGO juga sejalan dengan konsep swap baterai. Artinya, mereka akan menyediakan baterai untuk ditukarkan kepada pengguna yang kehabisan baterai, lewat aplikasi itu," kata dia.

Ecgo Bike Offers Cheap Electric Motors for only Rp. 8 Million, But ...
07 Nov 2019, 02:42 by Antara, Eko Ari Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Electric motorbike prices are still expensive because of the battery tag. For example, the Gesits electric motorcycle is around Rp. 25 million and Viar is Rp. 17 million to Rp. 18 million. The PT Green City Traffic (GCT) through the electric motorcycle ECGO Bike product -2 or easy go is offered at a low price of around Rp8 million.
The low price is because this motorbike is not sold with a battery, but consumers can rent it. This is done so that consumers without having to bother thinking about the price of expensive batteries.
COGO and CO-Founder of ECGO Bike, Rosyeni, explained that their startup offered a high-priced battery solution by rent. "Consumers only buy their motorbikes, the batteries don't need to, but they are rented for Rp.95,000 every month or if they reach 1,000 kilometers (whichever comes first)," Rosyeni said, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
If the cost is calculated at IDR 95,000 / 1,000 kilometers, for 1 kilometer the user only issues IDR 95. The battery rental price of Rp. 95,000 per month is certainly far cheaper than the cost of gasoline using conventional motorbikes.
Rosyeni explained, based on data from motorcycle users, users of electric-powered mounts were still 0.007 percent in Indonesia. So there are opportunities to market these environmentally friendly vehicles.
ECGO, which made its first appearance at the 2019 GIIAS exhibition, also attracted businessmen. Rosyeni said, to date there have been 388 stores committed to becoming ECGO distributors throughout Indonesia. "Dominant in Java, their enthusiasm is high. They have even mapped which areas will be ECGO's selling points," said Rosyeni.
Through the sales network that is being built, ECGO offers convenience to consumers to exchange batteries anywhere via mobile applications.
ECGO application on mobile phones will summarize various matters relating to the condition of the battery (low batt warning), anti theft warning, over heating, battery not in good health and and the mileage of an electric motorcycle.
The mechanism is that the battery can be connected to the server, then the server will communicate both ways to the user and the nearest ECGO dealer or shop.
"The presence of many interested people to become ECGO distributors is also in line with the battery swap concept. That is, they will provide batteries to be exchanged for users who run out of battery, through the application," he said.
